---
id: delete-a-webhook
title: "Delete a webhook"
description: "This route allows you to delete a webhook in your Port organization. You can also delete it via the [data sources page](https://app.getport.io/settings/data-sources) of your Port account.<br/><br/>To learn more about webhooks, check out the [documentation](https://docs.port.io/build-your-software-catalog/custom-integration/webhook/)."
sidebar_label: "Delete a webhook"
hide_title: true
hide_table_of_contents: true
api: 
sidebar_class_name: "delete api-method"
info_path: api-reference/port-api
custom_edit_url: null
---

import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";
import RequestSchema from "@theme/RequestSchema";
import StatusCodes from "@theme/StatusCodes";
import OperationTabs from "@theme/OperationTabs";
import TabItem from "@theme/TabItem";
import Heading from "@theme/Heading";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Delete a webhook"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"delete"}
  path={"/v1/webhooks/{identifier}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



This route allows you to delete a webhook in your Port organization. You can also delete it via the [data sources page](https://app.getport.io/settings/data-sources) of your Port account.<br/><br/>To learn more about webhooks, check out the [documentation](https://docs.port.io/build-your-software-catalog/custom-integration/webhook/).

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"schema":{"type":"string"},"in":"path","name":"identifier","description":"The identifier of the webhook you want to delete.<br/>","required":true}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>

<StatusCodes
  id={undefined}
  label={undefined}
  responses={{"200":{"description":"Default Response"}}}
>
  
</StatusCodes>
